messages.title: Why I am backing Paul for Newcastle
messages.content:
'Paul is a good, thoroughly decent local MP, with lots of cross-party respect in Newcastle. He's got a real track record of fighting for our NHS, our schools and all our people, young and old, whatever their politics. After all he's done here, he strongly deserves our support.'
Dr Allison Gardner
Clayton

messages.title: Paul's pledges to you
messages.content:
Protecting our precious NHS
No cuts and hospital closures, but proper investment in integrated health and social care.

Giving a great education to all
No school budget cuts, unlimited university fee rises, nor selection through the back door of 'free school.'

Respect and fairness in old age
Keeping pensions and the winter fuel allowance for all pensioners.

Investing in new jobs and skills
Attracting new industries, not losing more jobs abroad.

Getting the best European deal
Tories' hard Brexit threatens jobs, the environment and the harmony of future generations.

issues.brexitEurope: Tories' hard Brexit threatens jobs, the environment and the harmony of future generations.
issues.education:
No school budget cuts, unlimited university fee rises, nor selection through the back door of 'free school.'
Under the Tories, university fees have more than trebled to £9,250. Maintenance grants have been scrapped for yet more loans. And now interest on the debt is rising to over 6% a year. They just tried to lift the fee cap entirely and were stopped, but only till 2020. With a landslide, they'll go ahead.
issues.health:
Protecting our precious NHS
No cuts and hospital closures, but proper investment in integrated health and social care.

Paul with nurses at Bradwell, campaigning to save our local hospital - for the second time!
issues.labourEmployment:
Investing in new jobs and skills
Attracting new industries, not losing more jobs abroad.

One of Paul’s achievements in Parliament was gaining equal treatment for temporary and agency workers. This was implemented Europe-wide and aimed at tackling job insecurity now and the under-cutting of wages. It’s a protection now in the sights of ultra-free market Conservatives.
issues.socialWelfare:
Keeping pensions and the winter fuel allowance for all pensioners.
Respect and fairness in old age
Dismantling Cameron's 'legacy': pensions are next in line

After abandoning promises to protect the NHS and school budgets, Theresa May has put the PM's triple-lock for pensions next on her list. She has also ignored any welfare help for working and living longer. Labour believes pension pledges and rights should be honoured.

community.content:
Newcastle’s my home town, which I’ve been privileged to serve faithfully as your MP for 16 years now.

I’m 55, married with three children and still standing again, as I’m concerned about what Theresa May with a much bigger, unquestioning majority, will do!

Since last year, she has started dismantling all the promises David Cameron made – over the NHS, schools and pensions, to name but three.

At every turn, from bringing back fox-hunting to scrapping 'free' school dinners and cutting back on rail investment, the Tories seem to want to turn the clock back and create division.

Now, she leads a landslide with this opportunist election to give her a 'blank cheque' to do as she pleases, but when I and people meet the good people of Newcastle just won’t entrust it to her.

leaflet.personalStatement:
Newcastle’s my home town, which I’ve been privileged to serve faithfully as your MP for 16 years now.
I’m 55, married with three children and still standing again, as I’m concerned about what Theresa May with a much bigger, unquestioning majority, will do!
Since last year, she has started dismantling all the promises David Cameron made – over the NHS, schools and pensions, to name but three.
At every turn, from bringing back fox-hunting to scrapping 'free' school dinners and cutting back on rail investment, the Tories seem to want to turn the clock back and create division.
Now, she leads a landslide with this opportunist election to give her a 'blank cheque' to do as she pleases, but when I and people meet the good people of Newcastle just won’t entrust it to her.
